product_description: All Kaolin Porcelain tiles have achieved the highest Level A GreenRate rating from Global GreenTag.

product_categories.category_name: Floor Finishes and Tiling
Joinery and benchtop materials and systems

recyclable_percentage_description: It can be recycled with our Product Stewardship with Bingo and go into the roadbase as an example
recyclable_offcuts_description: For certain application we recommend to cut or fabricate with tiles in our factory prior to ship to Australia. In that case all the offcuts will be straight recycled and go back into the production.
recycled_content_description: All defect and broken tiles during the manufacturing process and recycled and used back into the production
recycling_process_description: All the components of procelain can be easily reprocessed back into the same raw materials or same product, which is porcelain tiles
end_of_life_program_description: We have a Product Stewardship program with Bingo. As a company, we place a strong emphasis on establishing and organizing end-of-life take-back and recovery programs for our products to promote responsible product stewardship. We understand the importance of managing the full lifecycle of our products and ensuring they are recycled or recovered in an environmentally sustainable manner.
water_reduction_techniques: We are proud to have implemented a water conservation system that allows us to reuse up to 100% of our water. Not only do we reintegrate this water back into our production processes, but we also ensure its purification for use in the irrigation system of neighboring farms. By maximizing our water efficiency and minimizing waste, we contribute positively to the environment and support sustainable practices in our local community.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: All our products are stored in our factorie's AI warehouse. AI warehouse allow us to stack pallets 30m height and therefore reduced the land footprint 6 times. It also allows us to achieve high accuracy and safety as there are not forklifts driving around. We do not stock any of our products in Australia and therfore our CO2 emissions are much smaller compared to suppliers having stock in Australia. We deliver items straight from our warehouse in China to construction site in Australia within 8 weeks. We have never missed this deadline.
minimisation_design_strategy: We recommend to design and work out wastage and set-out based on the size of tile and not just on pure square meterage.
modern_slavery_comments:
Yes. As part of our commitment to fair labor practices, we have third-party verified Modern Slavery Declarations (Level A GreenRate from Global Greentag), ensuring that our supply chain is free from any exploitative or unethical labor practices. These certifications and measures reflect our strong emphasis on social responsibility and equity, both within our organization and throughout our supply chain. We value the practice of fair labour. As a family business, we consider all our employees as part of the family and treat them like that. 95% of our workforce with experience of 10 years stayed with us and plans to stay. We attract talent from local area as well as from all over the country. Those values are being extended not only to our own employees, but to our partners and suppliers as well. We have practices in place to confirm and verify the fair treatment of labour in all the mines of raw materials.
As much as we try to verify the origin of materials and the practice of fair labour with respect to human rights, we also urge our customers to take that into consideration when choosing which material to supply. As a family business, we are terrified and truly disappointed to find out about horrible circumstances that labourers must work in some stone quarries, with child labour as not an exception. ILO identified up to 1 million children working in mines and quarries around the world. (https://www.ilo.org/ipec/areas/Miningandquarrying/lang--en/index.htm) We do encourage our customers, to make a choice not only for sustainable and environmentally friendly products, but also to make a conscious choice with respect to other families from all over the world.
As an organization, we are actively working to combat these unethical practices, and we urge the Australian A&D industry to be conscious of their sourcing decisions to prevent supporting such practices in the supply chain.
installation_risks_description: Low silica content (only 16%) - report from SafeWork Australia can be provided. For the installation need to follow Kaolin SDS.
factory_finished_description: Variety of finishes include polished, honed, matt, textured, leathered and anti-slip
specific_installation_methods: We recommend to install tiles with Green Certified glues and grouts to ensure it is possible to be recycled or to be biodegradable
other_comments: As we are a manufacturer, we hold Level A GreenRate from Global GreenTag for all our ranges, which is quite unique for Australia. Our Level A certification provides you with the maximum of points for assessments under the GBCA for Greenstar buildings. They recognize our Level A as the highest level of certification on the Australian Market. For example for GreenStar “Design and As Built v1.3” for clause 21.1 “Sustainable Products” our product gives you the highest coefficient value. As there are only 2 companies on the Australian Market that supply that level of porcelain tiles, the choice is very scare.
type_of_packaging: We work with recycled cardboard. As we store in our AI warehouse, we only pack pallets when it is ordered for specific client, therefor minimize the plastic wrapping.

minimisation_design_strategy: Layon Sheet size, substrate size, grain direction, Efficient matching options such as random mismatch.
modern_slavery_comments: These requirements are assessed annually as part of our FSC certification process.
specific_installation_methods: A natural sealant and compostable substrate should be selected to ensure full composability at end of life.
applied_finish_required_description: Once pressed onto board and fabricated, the timber veneer will need to be sealed.  There are various options depending on application including but not limited to LOW VOC water based, acrylic-urethane, poly-urethane single and 2 PAC coatings etc.
other_comments:
Sustainable wood veneers have many environmental benefits:
Low embodied energy
Carbon storage – growing trees absorb carbon dioxide which is then “locked up” for the life of the tree and wooden products made from that tree
Land use and biodiversity – Sustainably managed native forests are a natural ecosystem and consequently have high biodiversity. Plantations also support a reasonable degree of biodiversity.
Wood is a renewable resource
Veneer is one of the most environmentally efficient and economical ways to use beautiful timbers because one cubic metre of veneer can cover more than 1,000 m2 of panel surface

The Briggs Group is committed to the responsible use of the world’s resources. We are proud to have pioneered the use of Australian sustainable hardwoods for veneer, harvested in accordance with passing the strict environmental guidelines that are required by Government. By law, Australian State Forest land cannot be permanently cleared; it must always be replanted or regenerated.  Sustainable harvest means that the amount of timber that grows back each year is greater than, or equal to, the amount harvested. Furthermore, such forests are managed in accordance with strict laws and regulations to protect biodiversity, endangered species, water quality and other environmental values.  Additionally, all the Australian veneer that we get sliced, and all the veneer that we import, is checked under our Due Diligence program as being legally harvested.

recyclable_offcuts_description: Staron Solid Surfaces has minimal offcuts compared to many other surfacing products due to the seamless joining capabilities. We have implemented spec sheets for our fabricators so they can make samples from waste. These are used for our displays and to offer designers to assist colour selections. They are also gifted to customers for use as breadboards/cheese platters. And given to people for DIY crafts and small projects.
recycled_content_description: This is pre consumer content and reflects manufacturing processes to minimise waste and should not be confused with post-consumer recycled content.
recycling_process_description: It can be renewed and repaired insitu minimising the need to deconstruct. Alternatively, Staron can be removed and redesigned into new applications. Also, it can be used in other ways, as an alternative to other building materials such as: skirty and kicks as an example.
reusable_description: yes, Staron can be upcycled, reused, renewed, repaired at the projects end of life and implemented into other applications/projects.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: we outsource our deliveries or customers collect therefore this information cannot be answered properly.
minimisation_design_strategy: –Manufactured with a special technic means two pieces become one, maximising product yield and minimising offcuts and wastage. Offcuts are also used to reinforce joins for other applications reducing waste.  Alternatively designing to sheet sizes can also assist.
factory_finished_description: yes product is sanded
applied_finish_required_description: Final sanding after fabrication
other_comments: We have introduced strategies to support those interested in upcycling Staron for DIY projects.

product_description: Curated range of sustainable recomposed timber veneers

product_categories.category_name: Furniture and Loose Equipment
Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems
Joinery and benchtop materials and systems
Timber
Wall Covering

recyclable_offcuts_description: Yes — we encourage designers to reuse or upcycle offcuts and can provide guidance on effective ways to minimise waste.
reusable_description: The product can be reused where appropriate; its demountability depends on the installation method and application conditions.
water_reduction_techniques: Yes, 70% recycled water used at Veneer manufacturing site
minimisation_design_strategy: Align panel and joinery dimensions with standard sheet sizes to maximise material yield. For instance, designing 600 mm wide modules from a 1200 mm wide sheet minimises offcuts and waste compared to non-modular dimensions.
specific_installation_methods: Yes — where mechanical fixings are used, panels can be designed for demountability and reuse. Adhesive methods may limit recyclability or reinstallation potential.
applied_finish_required_description: Once fabricated, the timber veneer will need to be sealed. There are various options depending on the level of protection required, ranging from oils and waxes through to 2 pack polyurethane.
type_of_packaging: Reusable timber crates and pallets are used with recyclable plastic strapping. Veneer and edging are packaged in recycled cardboard. Veneer crates are wrapped in plastic to protect the veneer from water & sun light - this can be reused.

certifications.certification: Programme for the Endorsement of Forest Certification

recyclable_percentage_description: Onshore recycling facility installed at local Manufacturing plants.
recyclable_offcuts_description: The manufacturing of particleboard utilises recycled wood and off cuts in the production of new particleboard at Oberon facility. Offcuts of MDF is used for packing material and gluts.
recycling_process_description:
reDirect Wood Recycling has been established to provide a closed loop particleboard and wood recycling service. By installing a reDirect Recycling service you will enjoy significant cost savings in landfill charges.
The reDirect Wood Recovery Initiative has been designed to service polytec customers who are buying raw and melamine coated particleboard products. reDirect Wood Recycling will reclaim materials that would otherwise go to landfill, thereby reducing waste, preserving plantation pine forests and protecting the environment for future generations. The manufacturing of particleboard utilises recycled wood and off cuts in the production of new particleboard. By opting for wood off cut collection through reDirect Recycling you are assisting in creating sustainable manufacturing practices.
reusable_description: The entire product with edging or laminate can be recycled or repurposed.
end_of_life_program_description:
reDirect Wood Recycling has been established to provide a closed loop particleboard and wood recycling service. By installing a reDirect Recycling service you will enjoy significant cost savings in landfill charges.
The reDirect Wood Recovery Initiative has been designed to service polytec customers who are buying raw and melamine coated particleboard products. reDirect Wood Recycling will reclaim materials that would otherwise go to landfill, thereby reducing waste, preserving plantation pine forests and protecting the environment for future generations. The manufacturing of particleboard utilises recycled wood and off cuts in the production of new particleboard. By opting for wood off cut collection through reDirect Recycling you are assisting in creating sustainable manufacturing practices.
water_reduction_techniques:
polytec’s main source of water comes from our Waste Water Treatment Plant (WWTP). Community
town water is used only to supplement that which is consumed as recycled and softened water.
The WWTP treats effluent to a tertiary treatment level through Ultra filtration (UF) and Reverse
Osmosis (RO) and returned to the MDF facility as softened water for use in the boilers and or
manufacturing process. Approximately 2/3 of our Oberon Manufacturing facility daily water
requirement is supplied by our WWTP.
With the exception of a portion of the HPP site, the WWTP manages all the wastewater and
stormwater from the surrounding sites at the Oberon Timber Complex (OTC).
minimisation_design_strategy: Designing to the sheet sizes and try to optimise the sheet to its maximum.
modern_slavery_comments: https://modernslaveryregister.gov.au/statements/cuZyaGcaV1z5o3r/pdf/

type_of_packaging: Gluts and strapping.

recyclable_offcuts_description: MDF is acceptable for energy recovery. Gluts from MDF are manufactured from repurposed MDF and are consistently reclaimed and reused.
reusable_description: The entire door or benchtop with edging or laminate can be recycled or repurposed.
end_of_life_program_description: MDF is acceptable for energy recovery.

polytec’s main source of water comes from our Waste Water Treatment Plant (WWTP). Community
town water is used only to supplement that which is consumed as recycled and softened water.
The WWTP treats effluent to a tertiary treatment level through Ultra filtration (UF) and Reverse
Osmosis (RO) and returned to the MDF facility as softened water for use in the boilers and or
manufacturing process. Approximately 2/3 of our Oberon Manufacturing facility daily water

With the exception of a portion of the HPP site, the WWTP manages all the wastewater and

minimisation_design_strategy: Waste deduction is most effective when production is optimised for the highest possible yield of decorative board.

product_description: Easycraft Contours offer a versatile design solution for walls, ceiling and joinery.

Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems
Joinery and benchtop materials and systems
Timber

certifications.certification: Programme for the Endorsement of Forest Certification

recyclable_percentage_description: The entire product can be demounted for energy recovery.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Remember during onsite installation the product has been designed for no offcuts, as all optimisations completed at manufacture in Australia step with the size of the panels. During manufacturing, offcuts is used for packing material and gluts, and can be used in energy recovery.
reusable_description: The entire product can be demounted for reuse or energy recovery.
water_reduction_techniques:
polytec’s main source of water comes from our Waste Water Treatment Plant (WWTP). Community
town water is used only to supplement that which is consumed as recycled and softened water.
The WWTP treats effluent to a tertiary treatment level through Ultra filtration (UF) and Reverse
Osmosis (RO) and returned to the MDF facility as softened water for use in the boilers and or
manufacturing process. Approximately 2/3 of our Oberon Manufacturing facility daily water
requirement is supplied by our WWTP.
With the exception of a portion of the HPP site, the WWTP manages all the wastewater and
stormwater from the surrounding sites at the Oberon Timber Complex (OTC).
minimisation_design_strategy: The whole design of Easycraft Contours enables almost no onsite waste as products are sizes designed for install areas ready to put in with minimal additional resources and quicker time.
modern_slavery_comments: https://modernslaveryregister.gov.au/statements/cuZyaGcaV1z5o3r/pdf/

detailed_certifications.certification: Programme for the Endorsement of Forest Certification

specific_installation_methods: Easycraft Contours is designed from the outset to require less time and resources for fixing. This easy install has avoided additional time and materials for fixing. This improves reuse opportunities.
applied_finish_required_description: Raw timber
other_comments: Our website https://www.polytec.com.au contains all product information, including technical specifications, EPDs, installation information and warranty.
